title.native: 名探偵コナン ゼロの執行人

description:
There is a sudden explosion at Tokyo Summit's giant Edge of Ocean facility. The shadow of Touru Amuro, who works for the National Police Agency Security Bureau as Zero, appears at the site. In addition, the "triple-face" character known as Rei Furuya, a detective, and Kogorou Mouri's apprentice, is also known as Bourbon, a Black Organization member. Kogorou is arrested as a suspect in the case of the explosion. Conan conducts an investigation to prove Kogorou's innocence, but Amuro gets in his way.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Detective Conan Movie 22: Zero no Shikkounin
Meitantei Conan Movie 22: Zero no Shikkounin
名侦探柯南：零的执行人

tags.name: Tanned Skin

title.native: 名探偵コナン
名探偵コナン シークレット安室コール

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

__Height__: 180 cm (5'11")

[Website](https://fmsp.amob.jp/mob/index.php?site=F&ima=1113)

A Japanese singer-songwriter, guitarist, record producer, actor, radio personality, and photographer. He is one of the top male artists of Japan, and is a member of the entertainment company Amuse, Inc. He is known for his deep, low voice.

His debut voice-acting role was [Masaaki Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/character/40228/), a character in Doraemon created based on his image.

__Height__: 180 cm (5'11")

[Website](https://fmsp.amob.jp/mob/index.php?site=F&ima=1113)

A Japanese singer-songwriter, guitarist, record producer, actor, radio personality, and photographer. He is one of the top male artists of Japan, and is a member of the entertainment company Amuse, Inc. He is known for his deep, low voice.

His debut voice-acting role was [Masaaki Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/character/40228/), a character in Doraemon created based on his image.

__Height__: 180 cm (5'11")

[Website](https://fmsp.amob.jp/mob/index.php?site=F&ima=1113)

A Japanese singer-songwriter, guitarist, record producer, actor, radio personality, and photographer. He is one of the top male artists of Japan, and is a member of the entertainment company Amuse, Inc. He is known for his deep, low voice.

His debut voice-acting role was [Masaaki Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/character/40228/), a character in Doraemon created based on his image.
Vice President of Mouse. He is responsible for managing the animation side of the studio, including production management and staff supervision.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.
Daiki Matsukura is a CG artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖之)

Son of [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/). Brother of [Keiko Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上慶子)

Daughter of [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/). Sister of [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).
Hiromitsu Koiwa is a CG artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).
